pull.title: Fix rescanblockchain rpc to properly report progress
pull.body: Previously it assumed tip in all cases. This also extracts a RescanVerificationProgress helper object whose role is to manage reporting, in order to simplify ScanForWalletTransactions - more lines in total, but much simpler to follow the core logic.

rename.from: Fix ScanForWalletTransactions to report progress correctly when a pindexStop is supplied
rename.to: Fix rescanblockchain rpc to property report progress

events.body: Removed the refactoring for easier review.

Makes sense. Reporting progress for partial rescans based on the given range seems to be more logical.
utACK 409db40b6f56748a5b1713a0bc117a8365d9f3ef

From travis:
```
wallet/wallet.cpp: In member function ‘CBlockIndex* CWallet::ScanForWalletTransactions(CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*, const WalletRescanReserver&, bool)’:
wallet/wallet.cpp:1748:15: error: expected ‘;’ before ‘dProgressTip’
               dProgressTip = GuessVerificationProgress(chainParams.TxData(), tip);
               ^
```
Added semicolon, renamed progress vars to `progress_*`, and clang-formatted.

rename.from: Fix rescanblockchain rpc to property report progress
rename.to: Fix rescanblockchain rpc to properly report progress

verification.payload:
tree a5182dc9cebebd13f06fa07b9eed85eb61e27f98
parent 7eb7076f70078c06bef9752f22acf92fd86e616a
author Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1524684098 +0000
committer Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1525367890 -0400

Fix rescanblockchain rpc to property report progress

CWallet::ScanForWalletTransactions did not previously take into account
pindexStop when calculating progress.

Renamed progress vars to progress_*.

rescanblockchain is the only rpc that uses this parameter.

events.message:
Fix rescanblockchain rpc to property report progress

CWallet::ScanForWalletTransactions did not previously take into account
pindexStop when calculating progress.

Renamed progress vars to progress_*.

rescanblockchain is the only rpc that uses this parameter.

issue.title: commits from bitcoin/master
issue.body:
Make it clear which functions that are intended to be translation unit local
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13163

mempool: Add compile time checking for ::mempool.cs runtime locking assertions
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13080

[net] Don't incorrectly log that REJECT messages are unknown.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13162

Fix re-declared scoped enum as unscoped (Causes issues with some compilers)
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13180

Handle unsuccessful fseek(...):s
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13149

Add Windows shutdown handler
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13131

Fix rescanblockchain rpc to properly report progress
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13079

tests: Add test for 64-bit Windows PE, modify 32-bit test results
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13094

RPC Docs: gettxout*: clarify bestblock and unspent counts
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13184

comments.body: simpler to RAII this instead of a separate Constructor/Start/AnnounceStart methods?
The main reason I kept this separate is that `GuessVerificationProgress` needs `cs_main` held, and I wanted to minimize the amount of code in the lock-block.
